abstract: The Day: For Rockefeller University, there was never a Nobel like its 24th, awarded for achievement in medicine to Dr. Ralph M. Steinman, who had died of pancreatic cancer not 72 hours earlier. Also, what City Room is reading in other papers and blogs.
snippet: The Day: For Rockefeller University, there was never a Nobel like its 24th, awarded for achievement in medicine to Dr. Ralph M. Steinman, who had died of pancreatic cancer not 72 hours earlier. Also, what City Room is reading in other papers and...
lead_paragraph: Rockefeller University, on the Upper East Side, is hardly unfamiliar with Nobel prizes. Twenty-four of them have gone to people who teach at the university or are associated with it one way or another.

headline.main: 'Wonderful and Horrible' News of a Nobel Prize
